XII.ii.2.C.2.b
.
SSA Actions After Determining Eligibility
The table below describes the action SSA takes to certify a claimant’s entitlement to the special allowance under
38 U.S.C. 1312(a)
.
When SSA determines that …
Then SSA …
there are survivors eligible for the special allowance
returns
VA Form 21P-4180
with the appropriate notations
furnishes a copy of an award letter
furnishes enclosures for the award letter as described in
M21-1, Part XII, Subpart ii, 2.D.2
, and
furnishes one of the following forms to VA as authority for payment:
SSA Form 101
SSA Form 101C
,
or
SSA Form 101U3
.
there is
no
survivor eligible to receive the special allowance, or
the special allowance is
not
payable because there is entitlement to an old-age and survivors insurance payment
denies the claim, and
notifies the claimant.
Note
:  VA is
not
responsible for furnishing a notice of denial or review rights, except for an adverse determination as described in
M21-1, Part XII, Subpart ii, 2.B.1
, and then only if there is a specific claim for the special allowance.
